channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024070462
item.description:
Report E-2024070462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) additional 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070418
item.description:
Report E-2024070418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown quantity of Delta-Therm AE 7102 Isocyanate was released from (1) 3400-pound steel tank due to improper loading (the strap was not placed correctly and caused the valve to open). The release impacted the inside of the trailer. The tank was not damaged and they were able to get the valve closed and stopped releasing. No waste will be generated. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported 1-gallon of UN 1866 "Puma TC" was released from 1-5 gallon pail to the trailer floor after being crushed due to heavy stacking. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and the caller determined terminal personnel are capable of conducting clean up with the available PPE onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024070321
item.description:
Report E-2024070321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDP experienced a UN3265 Predator MR2516 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to a 6” x 1” area of the tote lid. The tote was wiped down with pads and the surface was confirmed neutral. The cap was re-tightened and secured and a slosh test was conducted to confirm there were no further leaks. The impacted pads were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.description:
Report X-2024071060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: BELLEVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS INSTRUCTED TO RESPOND TO A DECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE LEAKING A WHITE POWDER IN PACKAGE CAR 121. IN FULL PPE, CURRENT DECISION TREE, AND CART RESPONDER REPORTED TO PACKAGE CAR 121. PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE, RESPONSE SHEETS, AND WASTE DISPOSAL CHART.

item.title: Report X-2024070914
item.description:
Report X-2024070914

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS BEING REWRAPPED DUE TO PACKAGE DETERIORATION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 25 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B35222, THE PERSONAL BUTCHER, 225 MINEOLA BLVD APT 5I, MINEOLA NY 11501-2545.
